comment.author: 7573205@N06
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Ancient Egyptian Art, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 35226125@N08
comment._content: maybe they were eroded by time....

comment.author: 8376703@N02
comment._content: No--not erroded by time. It might have been simple vandalism; but more likely it was defaced by competing religious groups or by a proceding pharoh/authority figure. Destroying monuments was not only a way to wipe public record of the deceased's memory, but was also considered a literal violent act against the person depicted.  So if the face is bashed off of the monument here on earth, the deceased's face was thought to be disfigured in the afterlife.

comment._content: Christians defaced many a monuments both in Egypt and in Greece, because nudity was thought to be a shame so they knocked off the cocks of most male statues.
